info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 5:47AM CDT until July 14 at 7:45AM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Kimble and Mason.
* WHEN...Until 745 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 546 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated light to moderate rain due to thunderstorms across southern Kimble county and along the southern Mason County line. Movement was north at 15 mph. and This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Junction, Yates Crossing, Segovia, London, South Llano River State Park, Telegraph, Roosevelt, Hilda, Hedwigs Hill, Loyal Valley, The Intersection Of I-10 And Us 290, I-10 Near The Kimble-Kerr County Line, Us-83 Near The Kerr-Kimble County Line, Us-83 Near The Kimble-Menard County Line, Cleo, Us-377 Near The Kimble-Edwards County Line, I-10 Near The Sutton- kKmble County Line and Us-87 Near The Mason-Gillespie County Line. - This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 434 and 477. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM CDT THIS MORNING
